news.title: Physicists prove 'quantum spookiness' and start chasing Schrodinger's cat
news.summary: Home Physics Quantum Physics October 26, 2015 October 26, 2015 by Peter Mosley, The Conversation The world of quantum mechanics is weird.

news.title: Physicists prove 'quantum spookiness' and start chasing Schrödinger's cat
news.summary: Peter Mosley, University of Bath The world of quantum mechanics is weird. Objects that are far apart can influence each other in what Albert Einstein called "spooky action at a distance", and cats can potentially be dead and alive at the same time.

news.title: Physicists prove ‘quantum spookiness’ and start chasing Schrödinger’s cat
news.summary: The world of quantum mechanics is weird. Objects that are far apart can influence each other in what Albert Einstein called “spooky action at a distance”, and cats can potentially be dead and alive at the same time.
